META_DOCUMENTATION.description: Comprehensive Universal Documentation Standards (UDS) system for all 30+ document types across CodeRef ecosystem with 3-tier hierarchy, schema inheritance, and Python validator framework

reference_documents: coderef/user/DOCUMENT-TYPE-INVENTORY.md - 30+ document types identified across 9 categories
key_findings: Current validation coverage: Only 2/30+ document types validated (resource sheets, plan.json)
Foundation docs have UDS frontmatter but no validator
25+ document types have no frontmatter validation at all
Two metadata systems exist (RSMS for architectural docs, UDS for implementation docs) without clear boundaries

1_executive_summary.purpose: Create comprehensive Universal Documentation Standards (UDS) system covering all 30+ document types across CodeRef ecosystem with 3-tier hierarchy (Base UDS → Category Extensions → Type-Specific), 9 new JSON schemas with inheritance, 9 Python validators extending UDSValidator, and complete MCP server integration
1_executive_summary.value_proposition: Increase validation coverage from 6% (2/30 types) to 100%, ensure complete traceability for all documents, eliminate inconsistent metadata systems, and provide automated quality scoring for documentation health
1_executive_summary.real_world_analogy: Similar to establishing building codes for a city - create base safety requirements (Base UDS) that all buildings must meet, plus specialized codes (Category Extensions) for specific building types (residential, commercial, industrial), enforced by certified inspectors (validators) with standardized checklists (schemas)
1_executive_summary.use_case: Agent generates foundation doc → coderef-docs injects UDS frontmatter → FoundationDocValidator validates against schema → Returns ValidationResult with 0-100 score → Doc archived with complete traceability
1_executive_summary.output: 9 JSON schemas + 9 Python validators + MCP integration code + 6-phase migration plan covering all 30+ document types

2_risk_assessment.complexity: high (9 schemas, 9 validators, 30+ document types, 6-phase migration)
2_risk_assessment.scope: Affects all 5 MCP servers (coderef-docs, coderef-workflow, coderef-context, coderef-personas, coderef-testing) + papertrail
2_risk_assessment.file_system_risk: low (new files only, no breaking changes to existing schemas)
dependencies: Must maintain backward compatibility with RSMS v2.0 (no changes to resource-sheet-metadata-schema.json)
Must maintain backward compatibility with existing plan.json schema
Must maintain backward compatibility with communication.json schema
coderef-docs must adopt UDS validators for foundation doc generation
coderef-workflow must adopt UDS validators for workorder doc validation
performance_concerns: Validator execution time for large documentation sets (100+ files)
Schema validation overhead during doc generation
Mitigation: Cache compiled schemas, parallelize validation where possible
security_considerations: Path traversal in file references (related_files, related_docs)
Mitigation: Strict schema validation, path normalization, whitelist allowed fields
2_risk_assessment.breaking_changes: NONE - All existing schemas (RSMS v2.0, plan.json, communication.json) remain unchanged. New validators extend existing base classes. Phased rollout allows gradual adoption.

affected_files: papertrail/validator.py - Extend UDSValidator base class (if needed)

existing_internal: papertrail.validator.UDSValidator - Base class for all validators
papertrail.uds.UDSHeader - Data structure for UDS frontmatter
existing_external: pyyaml - YAML parsing for frontmatter extraction
new_internal: 9 new JSON schemas with inheritance pattern

3_current_state_analysis.architecture_context: Follows existing Papertrail patterns: Schema-based validation, UDSValidator inheritance, ValidationResult return type, JSON Schema Draft-07 with allOf inheritance, MCP tool exposure for programmatic access

primary_features: 3-tier UDS hierarchy: Base UDS (agent, date, task) → 8 Category Extensions → Type-Specific Fields
9 JSON schemas with inheritance pattern using allOf and $ref to base-frontmatter-schema.json
9 Python validator classes extending UDSValidator base class with consistent ValidationResult return type
ValidatorFactory with auto-detection based on file path patterns and frontmatter inspection
Complete coverage of all 30+ document types across 9 categories
secondary_features: MCP server integration code for coderef-docs and coderef-workflow
Backwards compatibility with RSMS v2.0, plan.json, communication.json schemas
Health scoring (0-100) for all validated documents
Auto-fix suggestions for common frontmatter errors
Batch validation support for entire directory trees
edge_case_handling: Missing frontmatter: Return ValidationResult with valid=False, clear error message
Invalid YAML syntax: Catch parsing errors, provide line number and syntax hints
Unknown doc_type: Warn but allow if base UDS fields present
Circular references: Detect in related_files/related_docs, warn if found
Legacy docs without frontmatter: Provide migration helper to inject base UDS
configuration_options: Validator strictness levels: strict (all errors fail), lenient (warnings only for non-critical)
Auto-fix mode: Enable/disable automatic frontmatter corrections
Schema validation depth: Base only, Category, or Full (type-specific)
